questions.question: In Chromatography, The Solvent (Water) Is The ________ Phase
Why Is Pencil Used To Draw The Baseline On The Paper?

choices.answer: Pen Ink Would Look Too Confusing
Pen Ink Would Also Travel Up The Paper

questions.question: Highly Soluble Substances Interact Strongly With The _________ Phase
How Do We Work Out R<sub>f</sub> Values?

choices.answer: Distance Moved By Solvent Front/Distance Moved By Ink Spot
Distance Moved By Ink Spot/Distance Moved By Solvent Front

questions.question: Poorly Soluble Components Interact Weakly With The ________ Phase
If The Ink Spot Doesn't Move Up The Paper, It Is _______
Which Of These Statements About Chromatography Is False?

choices.answer: Poorly Soluble Dyes Travel Far Up The Paper
Different Components Of A Mixture Move At Different Rates
Chromatography Is Used To Separate Coloured Solutions/Dyes
Highly Soluble Dyes Travel Far Up The Paper

questions.question: Why Aren't The Dyes Placed At The Bottom Of The Chromatography Paper? (IGCSE Q)

choices.answer: They Wouldn't Line Up With The Pencil Line
It Would Be Impossible To Calculate The R<sub>f</sub> Value
The Spots Will Dissolve In The Solvent, Not Travel Up Paper
The Dyes Won't Separate Out As They Travel Up The Paper

questions.question: The Food Dyes Didn't Move Far Up The Chromatography Paper. Solution?? (IGCSE Q)

choices.answer: Try Putting More Ink On The Spot
Draw The Pencil Line & Spots Further Away From The Solvent

questions.question: Which Method Of Separation Should Be Used To Obtain Sand From A Mixture Of Salt, Sand & Water?
